pollspain

Overview

The goal of pollspain is to â€¦

Installation

You can install the development version of R package {pollspain} from GitHub through the following code:

install.packages("devtools") # only if not already installed
devtools::install_github("dadosdelaplace/pollspain")
#> rlang (1.1.0 -> 1.1.1) [CRAN]

get functions

Censo (nivel: municipal)

Variables relativas a poblaciÃ³n (pop_res_mun, census_INE_mun, census_counting_mun, census_CERE_mun)

Datos del CERA

SegÃºn el INE:

Â«El censo electoral contiene la inscripciÃ³n de quienes reÃºnen los requisitos para ser elector y no se hallen privados, definitiva o temporalmente, del derecho de sufragio. El censo electoral estÃ¡ compuesto por:

  • El censo electoral de espaÃ±oles residentes en EspaÃ±a (CER).
  • El censo electoral de espaÃ±oles residentes-ausentes que viven en el extranjero (CERA).

El censo electoral de residentes en EspaÃ±a que sean nacionales de paÃ­ses con Acuerdos para las elecciones municipales (CERE Acuerdos), y el censo electoral de ciudadanos de la UniÃ³n Europea residentes en EspaÃ±a para las elecciones municipales y al Parlamento Europeo (CERE UE).Â»

La funciÃ³n get_CERA_data() nos devuelve los datos relativos al CERA

ccaa_CERA_data <- get_CERA_data(election_data, level = "ccaa")

Datos electorales agregados

La funciÃ³n get_elections_data() nos permite obtener los datos electorales de las elecciones pedidas y con el nivel (level) de agregaciÃ³n que queramos, pudiendo ser all, ccaa, prov, mun, mun_district, sec (secciÃ³n censal) y poll_station (a nivel de mesa electoral)

prov_data <- get_elections_data("congress", year = 2019, month = c(4, 11), level = "prov")
#> ðŸ”Ž Check if parameters are allowed...
#>    ðŸ”” Since include_candidacies = FALSE, aggregating by parties has not been implemented
#> ðŸ“¦ Get poll station data...

#>    - Aggregating election data at prov level...
#> âœ… Last summaries and tasks...

Esta funciÃ³n combina get_poll_station_data() (el dato en bruto por mesa electoral) con get_CERA_data() y aggregate_election_data(), que nos proporciona la agregaciÃ³n pedida. El cÃ³digo anterior es equivalente a:

# Raw data at poll station level
election_data <-
      get_poll_station_data("congress", year = 2019, month = c(4, 11))

# and then aggregate at provided level
prov_data <-
  election_data |>
  aggregate_election_data(level = "prov")
prov_data
#> # A tibble: 104 Ã— 27
#>    id_elec    type_elec date_elec  pop_res cod_INE_ccaa cod_INE_prov ccaa  prov 
#>    <glue>     <chr>     <date>       <dbl> <chr>        <chr>        <chr> <chr>
#>  1 02-2019-0â€¦ congress  2019-04-28  709340 01           04           Andaâ€¦ Almeâ€¦
#>  2 02-2019-0â€¦ congress  2019-04-28 1238714 01           11           Andaâ€¦ CÃ¡diz

Datos de elecciones

FunciÃ³n principal, combinando la extracciÃ³n y la agregaciÃ³n

  get_elections_data("congress", 2019, c(4, 11),

Es lo mismo extraer a nivel municipio que a un nivel mÃ¡s bajo y luego agrupar y sumarizar.

mun_data <-
  get_elections_data("congress", 2019, c(4, 11), 
                     include_candidacies = TRUE, level = "mun")
#> ðŸ”Ž Check if parameters are allowed...
#> ðŸ“¦ Get poll station data...
#>    - Download poll station data...
#>    - Aggregating election data at mun level...
#> ðŸ“¦ Get candidacies (parties) data...
#>    - Download candidacies (parties) data... (please wait, intensive task)
#>    - Aggregating candidacies data at mun level...
#> ðŸ–‡ Join information...
#> âœ… Last summaries and tasks...
mun_data |> filter(date_elec == "2019-04-28" & mun == "Dos Hermanas")
#> # A tibble: 13 Ã— 40
#>    id_elec    type_elec date_elec  pop_res cod_INE_ccaa cod_INE_prov cod_INE_mun
#>    <glue>     <chr>     <date>       <dbl> <chr>        <chr>        <chr>

mun_district_data <- get_elections_data("congress", 2019, c(4, 11),
                                        include_candidacies = TRUE,
                                        level = "mun_district")
#> ðŸ”Ž Check if parameters are allowed...
#> ðŸ“¦ Get poll station data...
#>    - Download poll station data...
#>    - Aggregating election data at mun_district level...
#> ðŸ“¦ Get candidacies (parties) data...
#>    - Download candidacies (parties) data... (please wait, intensive task)
#>    - Aggregating candidacies data at mun_district level...
#> ðŸ–‡ Join information...
#> âœ… Last summaries and tasks...
mun_district_data |>
  group_by(id_elec, type_elec, date_elec, cod_INE_mun, mun, id_candidacies) |>
  summarise(sum(ballots)) |>
  ungroup() |> 
  filter(date_elec == "2019-04-28" & mun == "Dos Hermanas")
#> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'id_elec', 'type_elec', 'date_elec',
#> 'cod_INE_mun', 'mun'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
